intro: Liebigia tenuipes, commonly known as the narrow-leaved liebigia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in Brazil and Paraguay. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in whorls along the stem. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid tropical forests. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
